clinical_study.brief_title: Testing of a Candy in Five Different Versions for the Additional Humidification of the Oral Cavity
clinical_study.official_title: Testing of a Candy in Five Different Versions for the Additional Humidification of the Oral Cavity (DESERTO)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to investigate whether a candy can increase moisture of the oral cavity and reduce dryness of mouth.

detailed_description.textblock: A candy (available on the market from a Swiss manufacturer (Ricola)), free of ingredients that could interfere with the investigation, is tested in five different versions on different days. It is to analyse whether these candies can increase moisture of the oral cavity and reduce dryness of mouth.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: doppel- blind testing of 5 different variations of a candy in each participant by (unstimulated and stimulated) salivary flow rate; each participant is testing each variation of candy once in a randomized order at 5 consecutive days

primary_outcome.time_frame: one point assessment following consumption of candy (approx 5 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: dryness of mouth- sensation by Visual analogue scale (VAS); 0 = does not apply; 10 = is absolutely true.

primary_outcome.time_frame: before and after consumption of candy (approx 5 minutes for each salivary flow measurement)
primary_outcome.description: Change in salivary flow rate (ml/min) before and after stimulation (mechanical and gustatory) by consumption of candy

Exclusion Criteria:
